wikipedia_page.main: Catherine Murray, Countess of Dunmore (31 October 1814 – 12 February 1886), was an English peeress and promoter of Harris Tweed.

response: *Catherine Murray, Countess of Dunmore (1814–1886), British peeress
* Catherine Murray, Countess of Dunmore, commissions "the Paisley Sisters" of Strond on Harris to weave tweed in the Clan Murray tartan, origin of the commercial Harris Tweed industry.

link_mentions.page: Catherine Herbert, The Countess of Dunmore

response: * Catherine Murray, Countess of Dunmore (née Herbert) (1814–1886) wife of the sixth Earl

She worked with the landowner Catherine Murray, Countess of Dunmore to create the business of weaving Harris Tweed. The Countess had inherited  of the Dunmore estate on the "island" of Harris in 1845 when her husband died.
